name: aws-dynamodb
label: AWS DynamoDB
description: AWS DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. This connector facilitates the automate operations related to manage database table, data and backup.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.description: Type of configuration using which you will provide credentials to access AWS CloudWatch Logs and perform automated actions. You can select between Assume Role or Access Credentials. If you select Assume Role, then enter details in the following field(s): AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS CloudWatch Logs. AWS Access Key ID: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services. AWS Secret Access Key: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services. AWS Instance IAM Role: ARN IAM Role of your AWS instance to access CloudWatch Log services. If you select Access Credentials, then enter details in the following field(s): AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS CloudWatch Logs. AWS Access Key ID: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services. AWS Secret Access Key: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.

Assume Role.title: AWS Access Key
Assume Role.name: aws_access_key_id
Assume Role.description: The access key for users AWS account

Assume Role.title: AWS Secret Key
Assume Role.name: aws_secret_access_key
Assume Role.description: The secret key for user's AWS account.

Assume Role.title: Region Name
Assume Role.name: region_name
Assume Role.description: AWS Region to use, for example, us-west-1 or us-west-2 etc

Assume Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role
Assume Role.name: aws_iam_role
Assume Role.tooltip: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access CloudWatch Logs services.
Assume Role.description: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access CloudWatch Logs services. Ensure that the user has a trust relationship with the role with action STS Assume Role enabled

Access Credentials.title: AWS Access Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_access_key_id
Access Credentials.description: The access key for users AWS account

Access Credentials.title: AWS Secret Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_secret_access_key
Access Credentials.description: The secret key for user's AWS account.

Access Credentials.title: Region Name
Access Credentials.name: region_name
Access Credentials.description: AWS Region to use, for example, us-west-1 or us-west-2 etc

operations.title: Create Table
operations.description: Adds a new table in AWS DynamoDB

parameters.title: Table Name
parameters.description: The name of the table to be created.
parameters.tooltip: A table name should be between 3 and 255 characters, containing only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.)
parameters.name: TableName

parameters.title: Partition Key Name
parameters.description: The partition key is part of the table's primary key. It is a hash value that is used to retrieve items from your table and allocate data across hosts for scalability and availability.
parameters.tooltip: A name of the partition key. 1 to 255 characters and case sensitive.
parameters.name: partitionKeyName

parameters.title: Partition Key Data Type
parameters.description: The data type for the partition key
parameters.tooltip: The data type for the partition key
parameters.name: partitionKeyDataType

parameters.title: Sort Key (Optional)
parameters.description: The sort key is second part of the table's primary key. The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
parameters.tooltip: The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
parameters.name: sortKey

true.title: Sort Key Name
true.description: A name of the sort key.
true.tooltip: A name of the sort key. 1 to 255 characters and case sensitive.
true.name: sortKeyName

true.title: Sort Key Data Type
true.description: The data type for the sort key
true.tooltip: The data type for the sort key
true.name: sortKeyDataType

parameters.title: Billing Mode
parameters.description: This controls how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity
parameters.tooltip: Select 'Provisioned' mode for predictable workloads or Select 'On Demand' for unpredictable workloads
parameters.name: billingMode

Provisioned.title: Read Capacity
Provisioned.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second
Provisioned.tooltip: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second
Provisioned.name: readCapacityUnits

Provisioned.title: Write Capacity
Provisioned.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second
Provisioned.tooltip: The maximum number of writes consumed per second
Provisioned.name: writeCapacityUnits

operations.title: Delete Table
operations.description: Deletes an existing table from AWS DynamoDB

parameters.title: Table Name
parameters.description: The name of the table to be deleted
parameters.tooltip: The name of the table to be deleted
parameters.name: TableName

parameters.title: Table Name
parameters.description: The name of the table to be updated.
parameters.tooltip: The name of the table to be updated.
parameters.name: TableName

parameters.title: Operation
parameters.description: Select operation to be performed on the table
parameters.tooltip: Select operation to be performed on the table
parameters.name: updateOperation
options: Create a New Global Secondary Index

Modify Provisioned Throughput.title: Billing Mode
Modify Provisioned Throughput.description: The partition key is part of the table's primary key. It is a hash value that is used to retrieve items from your table and allocate data across hosts for scalability and availability.
Modify Provisioned Throughput.tooltip: The partition key is part of the table's primary key.
Modify Provisioned Throughput.name: billingMode

Provisioned.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second

Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.title: Stream Status
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.description: Enables or disable DynamoDB Streams on the table.
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.tooltip: Check to enable DynamoDB Streams on the table.
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.name: streamEnabled

Enable.title: Stream View Type
Enable.description: Capture item-level changes in your table, and push the changes to a DynamoDB stream.
Enable.tooltip: Select which information to be pushed on DynamoDB stream for any changed items in the table
Enable.name: streamViewType

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Index Name
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: The name of the global secondary index to be created.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: A index name should be between 3 and 255 characters, containing only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.)
Create a New Global Secondary Index.name: indexName

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Partition Key Name
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: The partition key of the global index
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: A name of the partition key. 1 to 255 characters and case sensitive.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.name: partitionKeyName

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Partition Key Data Type
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: The data type for the partition key
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: The data type for the partition key

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Sort Key (Optional)
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: The sort key of the global index.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.name: sortKey

parameters.tooltip: Provide a value for the partition key

parameters.title: Sort Key
parameters.description: Provide a value for the sort key.
parameters.tooltip: For a composite primary key, you must provide values for both the partition key and the sort key.

parameters.title: Additional Attributes
parameters.description: Add additional attributes other than primary key attributes.
parameters.tooltip:
Provide data in json format: { 'AttributeName': {'S': 'Value'}, 'AttributeName': { 'N': 'Value'} }. 
Where 'S'=String, 'N'=Number, 'B'=Binary, 'SS'=StringSet, 'NS'=NumberSet, 'BS'=BinarySet, 'M'=Dictionary, 'L'=List, 'NULL'=boolean, 'BOOL'=boolean
parameters.name: additionalAttributes

operations.title: Create Global Table
operations.description: Creates a global table from an existing table.

parameters.title: Global Table Name
parameters.description: The global table name to be created.
parameters.tooltip: The global table name to be created.
parameters.name: globalTableName

parameters.title: Region Name
parameters.description: The Region where the global table needs to be created.
parameters.tooltip: Region where the global table needs to be created.
parameters.name: regionName

operations.description: Returns information about the specified global table.

parameters.title: Global Table Name
parameters.description: The name of the global table.
parameters.tooltip: The name of the global table.
parameters.name: globalTableName

operations.title: Get Global Table List
operations.description: Lists all global tables that have a replica in the specified Region.

operations.title: Create Table Backup

parameters.description: The name of the table to be backup

parameters.description: Specified name for the backup.

operations.title: Describe Table Backup
operations.description: Describes an existing backup of a table.

parameters.title: Backup ARN
parameters.description: The AWS Resource Name (ARN) associated with the backup.
parameters.tooltip: The AWS Resource Name (ARN) associated with the backup.

operations.title: Delete Table Backup
